snippet: The Schomburg Center is establishing a new center for the analysis of the trans-Atlantic slave trade, thanks to a $2.5 million private gift.
abstract: Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture is establishing major new center for studying trans-Atlantic slave trade; center, to be called Lapidus Center for the Historical Analysis of Trans-Atlantic Slavery and endowed with $2.5 million gift from Ruth and Sid Lapidus, will be first of its kind based in a public research library.
lead_paragraph: The Schomburg Center is establishing a new center for the analysis of the trans-Atlantic slave trade, thanks to a $2.5 million private gift.
